title: [Large-scale] Mobile Social Education Design Using Blended Learning and Person-Centered Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Digital Device Usage Skills and Fundamental Social Studies Concepts
context.additional_context: Focused on providing personalized learning experiences in smartphone-centric limited technological environments, with continuous monitoring of learning processes through formative assessment

learning_goals: Learners can establish and execute a self-directed learning plan using mobile devices at least three times per week in a blended learning environment
Through a learner-centered feedback system, learners can write reflective reports linking their career goals and learning outcomes every four weeks
In small-group collaborative activities, learners can achieve at least 80% proficiency in social interaction skills (communication, conflict management) through peer assessment

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
